DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response used to determine the quantity of lenalidomide previously given during the continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order._A thalidomide analog with potential antineoplastic activity.  Lenalidomide inhibits TNF-alpha production, stimulates T cells, reduces serum levels of the cytokines vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), and inhibits angiogenesis.  This agent also promotes G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis of malignant cells._Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse._A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:A thalidomide analog with potential antineoplastic activity.  Lenalidomide inhibits TNF-alpha production, stimulates T cells, reduces serum levels of the cytokines vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), and inhibits angiogenesis.  This agent also promotes G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis of malignant cells.

Concepts.definition: A thalidomide analog with potential antineoplastic activity.  Lenalidomide inhibits TNF-alpha production, stimulates T cells, reduces serum levels of the cytokines vascular endothelial growth factor (VEGF) and basic fibroblast growth factor (bFGF), and inhibits angiogenesis.  This agent also promotes G1 cell cycle arrest and apoptosis of malignant cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.:A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

Concepts.definition: Continuation of treatment for an extended period of time to prevent relapse.
A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

DataElementConcept.origin: ECOG CRF:Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group Case Report Form

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A quantity of an agent (such as substance or energy) administered, taken, or absorbed at one time.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.: A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 9 and less than 11 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.: A measure of weight.  A milligram is approximately 450,000 times smaller than a pound and 28,000 times smaller than an ounce.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 4 and less than 6 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of four and one.
A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The amount of medicine taken, or radiation given, at one time.
